text: Jefferson County is a county in the U.S. state of Idaho. As of the 2020 census, 30,891 people lived there. The county seat and largest city is Rigby. The county was founded in 1913 and named after Thomas Jefferson, the 3rd President of the United States (1801â€“1809). == Communities == === Cities === * Hamer * Lewisville * Menan * Mud Lake * Rigby * Ririe * Roberts === Unincorporated communities === * Grant * Heise * Monteview * Terreton == References == Category:1913 establishments in Idaho Category:Idaho counties
title: Jefferson County, Idaho
